title: What are the scholarships available after 10th class? - Quora
tags: College and University Scholarship and Fellowships

response.answer_text: Siksha Abhiyan Scholarship for 10th Passed Students.(Students who are studying in class 8 to 12 are eligible for the scholarship test, Mode- Online Apply)Nationwide Education And Scholarship Test (NEST) Scholarships.(For appearing in both Junior I & II scholarship tests, the student must have passed 10th level link- https://www.nest.net.in/)All India Meritorious Scholarship for 10th Pass Students.(Students of Class 11 and Class 12 students are eligible to apply , Merit-based scholarship- 62 meritorious students will receive scholarship, link- http://aimst.org/)CBSE Single Girl Child Scholarship.( Can forward to all girls.Parents having a single girl child,Candidates with a score of 60% or 6.2 CGPA in CBSE class 10 board are eligible for the scholarship,link-http://cbse.nic.in/Scholarship/Webpages/Guidelines%20and%20AF.html)NCERT Scholarship:( Candidate should not be more than 18 years old. link - National Council Of Educational Research And Training)National Institute of Certified Education (NICE) Scholarship.The students must sit for the examinationThe student must be from the ICSC/CBSE/SSC boardlink-National Scholarship Exam - NICE Foundationpic.reference-The Economic Times

A2A by Nikita Pareek CBSE used to provide scholarships for students of class 10 and class 12 earlier but as far as I know since the NDA government took over the administration in 2014, scholarships have been ceased from the next year. My elder sister got scholarship only for one year (she passed 12th in 2014) which could not be renewed. We still don’t know whether it was our mistake or the scholarship got canceled. Further, there are too many restrictions on scholarships in CBSE. For class 10, the student should be a single girl child. The family income bracket should not be more than ___, which was a negligible amount. So, I would suggest that you should search for scholarships from other organizations. Maybe some NGOs working in this sector provide you with scholarship. But again, the income bracket of the family must be negligible. You can look up the site of MCD and also the local MLA’s office might be providing some scholarships to students in their area.  Hope this helps!
